intro: Oenanthe montana, commonly known as mountain water-dropwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and compound leaves that are often finely divided. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late summer. Oenanthe montana prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is noted for its aromatic foliage.
